bestBHT.bht: The healing of the demoniac in the synagogue caused a great number of sick people to seek Jesus, illustrating the profound impact it had on the popular mind. Despite attempts to hinder Him, Jesus continued His mission to proclaim the good news and heal those in need. Mark's detailed account highlights the determination of the multitudes, who relentlessly sought Him until they found Jesus. His purposeful departure did not deter Him from meeting their needs before moving on. (77 words)

Henry Alford: The great number of sick which were brought to the Lord...is accounted for by some from His departure having been fixed on and known beforehand.
It is perhaps more simple to view it as the natural result of the effect of the healing of the dæmoniac in the synagogue, on the popular mind.
The effect of the healing of the dæmoniac...on the popular mind.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: What a contrast to the Gadarenes!"
The nature of His mission required Him to keep moving.
That all might hear the glad tidings.
Marvin Vincent: Came unto him. Stronger than came to; for ewv is even up to, showing that they did not discontinue their search until they found him.
Mark's narrative here is fuller and more graphic.
Archibald T. Robertson: The multitudes kept at it until 'they came unto him' (ηλθον εως αυτου, aorist active indicative). They accomplished their purpose, εως αυτου, right up to him.
They tried to hinder him. The conative imperfect active of κατεχω, an old and common verb.
The use of μη (not) after κατειχον is the neat Greek idiom of the redundant negative after a verb of hindering like the French ne (Robertson, Grammar, p. 1171).
John Gill: He rose a great while before it was day... but did not go out till it was day."
He went into a desert place... that he might be retired from company.
They did all they could to persuade him, to abide with them constantly, and not think of removing from them.

bhtAttempts.bht: After healing the demon-possessed man in the synagogue, the news of Jesus' miraculous power spread quickly, and a great number of sick came seeking healing from him. This overwhelming response can be attributed to the effect that the healing had on the popular mind. Despite the attempts of some to hinder him, Jesus continued to minister to and heal the multitudes. His mission required him to keep moving and proclaim the good news to all who would hear. Mark's account emphasizes the persistence of the people in their search for Jesus, as they did not discontinue their search until they found him. In contrast to the Gadarenes, who asked Jesus to leave their region, these people sought after him fervently. Jesus, knowing the purpose of his departure, willingly met their needs before moving on to the next place. (70 words)

After the healing of the demoniac in the synagogue, news of Jesus' miraculous power spread, prompting a multitude of sick people to seek Him out for healing. Their persistent search demonstrated the impact that the healing had on the popular mind. Despite efforts by some to hinder Him, Jesus continued His mission to proclaim the good news and heal those in need. Mark's account vividly portrays the determination of the people, who did not stop until they found Jesus. His departure was intentional, yet He lovingly met their needs before moving on. (75 words)

After the healing of the demoniac in the synagogue, a multitude of sick people sought out Jesus for healing, their persistent search reflecting the deep impact it had on the popular mind. Despite attempts to hinder Him, Jesus continued His mission to proclaim the good news and heal the people. Mark's detailed account highlights the determination of the searchers, who did not give up until they found Jesus. His departure was planned, yet He compassionately attended to their needs before moving on. (72 words)

The healing of the demoniac in the synagogue caused a great number of sick people to seek Jesus, illustrating the profound impact it had on the popular mind. Despite attempts to hinder Him, Jesus continued His mission to proclaim the good news and heal those in need. Mark's detailed account highlights the determination of the multitudes, who relentlessly sought Him until they found Jesus. His purposeful departure did not deter Him from meeting their needs before moving on. (77 words)

The healing of the demoniac in the synagogue had a profound effect on the popular mind, resulting in a multitude of sick people seeking Jesus for healing. Despite attempts to hinder Him, Jesus remained faithful to His mission of proclaiming the good news and providing healing to those in need. The account given by Mark vividly portrays the determination of the people in their relentless search for Jesus. His departure was intentional, yet He compassionately attended to their needs before moving on. (75 words)
